column1: We were down in the street. The avenue was crowded. On days when the weather is so beautiful
column2: the afternoon personal hour is usually the hour of the supplementary walk. As always
column3: the big Musical Tower was playing with all its pipes
column4: the March of the United State. The Numbers
column6: thousands of Numbers in light blue unifs (probably a derivative of the ancient uniform) with golden badges on the chest
column7: — the State number of each one
column13: were but one of the innumerable waves of a powerful torrent. To my left
column14: O-90 (if one of my long-haired ancestors were writing this a thousand years ago
column15: he would probably call her by that funny word
column19: a she-Number and a he-Number.Blue sky
column20: tiny baby suns in each one of our badges; our faces are unclouded by the insanity of thoughts. Rays.... Do you picture it? Everything seems to be made of a kind of smiling
